#Text=Venezuela-Colombia crisis : Castro intervenes , Chavez and Uribe scheduled to meet
#Text=Tuesday , February 1 , 2005
#Text=South America — The President of Colombia Alvaro Uribe is scheduled to meet the President of Venezuela Hugo Chávez Thursday .
#Text=Apparently the crisis between Venezuela and Colombia is almost solved .
#Text=The crisis began with the imprisonment of the alleged FARC member Rodrigo Granda by Colombian forces on December 13 , 2004 .
#Text=Venezuela accused Colombian of invading Venezuelan territory .
#Text=Colombia accused Venezuela of harboring FARC terrorists .
#Text=The President of Cuba , Fidel Castro , intervened in the crisis and talked to Chavez and Uribe .
#Text=According to Bogota 's newspaper El Tiempo , Uribe asked for Castro 's help on January 21 .
#Text=Castro responded with surprising speed and effectiveness .
#Text=On January 21 Castro sent the chancellor Felipe Perez Roque to Caracas where he met with Chávez and then returned to Havana , informing Castro on the results of the encounter .
#Text=After midnight Castro communicated by telephone with Uribe for two hours .
#Text=They decided that Castro would send his Vice-chancellor with a letter detailing what they had talked about to Chávez .
#Text=During the World Social Forum in Porto Alegre Chavez appeared to be optimistic about the end of the crisis .
#Text=He recognized the importance of Castro 's role in the resolution of the problems between Colombia and Venezuela .
#Text=Also he was thankful for the help of the other leaders in South America .
#Text=The crisis between Venezuela and Colombia lasted more than a month without a solution and it was entering a dangerous stage , with severe accusations from both sides .
#Text=During recent days the US government became more interested in the conflict and was pressuring Chávez for a clear declaration about his relationship with the FARC .
#Text=The US is an ally of Colombia in the fight against FARC .
#Text=FARC is a member of , and supported by , the Foro de São Paulo , an alleged anti-imperialism and anti-liberalism organization of South America .
#Text=Other Forum de São Paulo member states include Brazil , Cuba and Venezuela .
#Text=Chronology
#Text=There is some uncertainty about the date of some events .
#Text=2004 - December
#Text=13 : FARC-EP member Rodrigo Granda is arrested by Colombian authorities .
#Text=15 : The Colombian National Police director Jorge Daniel Castro says Granda was arrested in Cúcuta , Colombia .
#Text=16 : Sources of the Cúcuta police say Granda was arrested in a city hotel .
#Text=17 : Another source of the Cúcuta police says Granda was arrested in a street of the Norte de Santander capital , Colombia .
#Text=30 : The FARC say Granda was kidnapped .
#Text=2005 - January
#Text=3 : The FARC demand Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez to begin a investigation .
#Text=5 : Venezuelan Minister Jesse Chacón says that Venezuela did n't take part in the capture of Granda .
#Text=5 : The Colombian Minister of Defense Jorge Alberto Uribe says that Colombian forces captured Granda inside Colombian territory .
#Text=6 : The Colombian President Álvaro Uribe also says that Colombian forces captured Granda inside Colombian territory .
#Text=9 : The Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez says that the Colombian police lies about the Granda capture .
#Text=12 : The Colombian Minister of Defense Jorge Alberto Uribe says that a reward was paid for Granda .
#Text=He reiterates that Colombian forces captured Granda inside Colombian territory .
#Text=13 : The National Police director Jorge Daniel Castro says that Colombian authorities did n't take part of the arrestment of Granda in Caracas , Venezuela .
#Text=13 : Chavez says that Venezuelan ambassador should leave Bogotá in Colombia .
#Text=20 : Lula da Silva talks to Colombian president Álvaro Uribe .
#Text=21 : Fidel Castro intervened .
#Text=A meeting between Uribe and Chaves is scheduled .
#Text=The crisis seems to be solved .
